page.title: 08LIVESTOCK IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
Although the land is mainly used for arable farming, small areas of pasture are found near some farm buildings. At Little Catworth, this grassland still shows clear traces of the old ridge and furrow method of cultivation.
Sheep are rare, and the pasture is generally grazed by cattle. Notable among these are the pedigree Murray Greys and North Devons at Tilbrook Grange, which regularly win prizes at the East of England Show.
Nearby, at Blackwell Manor Farm, fourteen electrically-ventilated buildings house 22O,OOO broiler chickens. The chickens arrive at the farm a few hours after hatching and remain there for forty-nine days. At the end of that period they are sold to fill the supermarket freezers.
